the following messages appeared in the terminal:-

item.title: Whonix 10 error installing languages
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Language and keyboard layout are two different settings:

  • https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Language
  • https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Keyboard_Layout

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix 10 error installing languages
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
i have an alternative easy way to get different languages installed, because the one which is inside the link it never worked for me so far. so here is an easy way hope u add it to the list of changing languages since we r on KDE interface.

rathar than going through konsole and then going to this path:-

Start menu -> Applications -> System -> System Settings -> Locale -> Languages -> Change Language

its better to make it one way which is by using this path without the konsole:-

Start menu -> Computer -> System Settings -> Input Devices -> Keyboard -> Layouts -> (Tick) Configure layouts -> + Add -> choose any language you prefere

or even same as ur path at the first, since we both want the user reach to system settings:-

Start menu -> Application-> System -> System Settings -> Input Devices -> Keyboard -> Layouts -> (Tick) Configure layouts -> + Add -> choose any language you prefere

to show u in images:-

http://s10.postimg.org/eom36p2mg/lang_1.jpg

http://s11.postimg.org/fo9l6gjc2/lang_2.jpg

http://s28.postimg.org/5cyqsz8zg/lang_3.jpg

http://s16.postimg.org/olrn0p2uc/lang_4.jpg

http://s11.postimg.org/cbajb84iq/lang_5.jpg

also there is i think a fixation to the command in the languages link:-

http://s14.postimg.org/3z18ekj8f/lang_alter.jpg

why i did say “i think”, because when i copy&paste here the big size 1 (or look a like) it turned to be similar to this |.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix 10 error installing languages
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Reason:

  • Most likely: temporary Tor failure.
  • Less likely: Debian mirror temporarily down.
  • Even less likely: something else.

Solution:

  • stop the current attempt (ctrl + c)
  • change your circuit (example using arm: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Controller#Arm)
  • try again

Read full topic
